TopicTitle: What have you been playing recently? (Other than KSP)

Articles.Content:
Rimworld. I can't stop playing Rimworld. I'd call it my new KSP but I'm also still playing KSP.

OH NO I HAVE 2 KSPs!

Kingdom Come: Deliverance

Open-word first-person medieval RPG. Its excellent.

Especially if you like armour, a full set can consist of up to 14 items.

The quality of the voice acting is notable too.

I haven’t really been playing anything else.

Though I want to get Astroneer, my laptop’s ‘Intel HD Graphics’ prevent me.

Tunnel Rush

http://poki.com/en/g/tunnel-rush

It's a nice reflex-based game, and I find it to be non-addictive. Which is good, for me

Some Factorio, as always, and also Cataclysm: Dark Days Ahead (a post-apocalyptic survival roguelike with surprising depth, and also FOSS), Cogmind (a scifi roguelike with a surprisingly firm grasp on tile graphics), Aurora 4X (a grand strategy game which makes up for its graphics a thousandfold in gameplay depth), a bit of Overload (6DOF arcade shooter—great fun if simplistic), and Children of a Dead Earth (like KSP but with moar dakka and quite a lot more engineering).
ive completed my gang banger trainer in saints row and decided to turn my life around and become fire ranger in firewatch.
already completed firewatch and.......its garbage
Lol last game i played was roblox

I got a few hours into The Long Dark again.

And rediscovered Civ VI. Gamed the system by playing Montezuma against France. Went straight for Paris with my Eagle Warriors on a duel sized pangea map and finishing with a domination victory before she could pull the world into the medieval era. With that first Deity win off the table I can return to my comfortable Prince difficulty.

I still need to finish the first Deus Ex.

What's weird is that it's fairly old and still has better facial animations than many modern games.

On 7/12/2018 at 2:06 PM, RealKerbal3x said:

I haven’t really been playing anything else.

Though I want to get Astroneer, my laptop’s ‘Intel HD Graphics’ prevent me.

Just get astroneer, even at 2 FPS I think it would be worth it for the sounds dtrack alone.

I've been playing a lot of CS:GO, but I still have less than a hundred hours in it.

4 hours ago, Kernel Kraken said:

Just get﻿ astroneer, even at 2 FPS I think it would be worth it for the sounds dtrack alone.

True, I've seen a few streams of Astroneer and the OST is one of my favourite game soundtracks.

I have been playing a LOT of unturned lately.I already played on every single map(even Yukon)And I only need 3 achievements to complete the game.

And last month I bought surviving mars.

It's a good game.i played 2 of the misteries(beyond earth and metraton)
Scratch. Lots and Lost of Csratch.

Banished, SimCity 4, and Roller Coaster Tycoon 3 (Platinum)

Oh, and my French Horn and Ukulele...

23 hours ago, adsii1970 said:

Roller Coaster Tycoon 3 (Platinum)

ugh...

RCT 1 and 2 are better.

12 minutes ago, Delay said:

ugh...

RCT 1 and 2 are better.

I agree totally. But until last night, I hadn't installed RCT2 on this machine. It's been installed now. Oh, and RCTW sucks, too. I like the cheesiness of RCT2...

I have a backlog of unplayed games that I have to revert to from time-to-time...  I only buy them after they go into firesale el'cheapo mode so I tend to buy them in batches opportunistically and let em sit for awhile.  Come to think of it, I may have left KSP sit unplayed for nearly a year before tinkering with it.  

Anyhoo...  last week it was a one-day 8hr marathon playthru of the original Portal.  At the end of which I could not wipe the stupid grin off my face listening to the endgame song!   This week it's the sequel, Portal 2.

2 minutes ago, XLjedi said:

I have a backlog of unplayed games that I have to revert to from time-to-time...  I only buy them after they go into firesale el'cheapo mode so I tend to buy them in batches opportunistically and let em sit for awhile.  Come to think of it, I may have left KSP sit unplayed for nearly a year before tinkering with it.  

Anyhoo...  last week it was a one-day 8hr marathon playthru of the original Portal.  At the end of which I could not wipe the stupid grin off my face listening to the endgame song!   This week it's the sequel, Portal 2.  

True story, I installed Steam because they were giving away Portal 2 for free and I figured why not. Now I have over 100 games on Steam. Portal 2 is exactly what Portal needed and I think you'll really like it.

One of those games, Rimworld, I am STILL playing to the near exclusion of all other entertainment, a month after starting it up again upon the 0.19 nee 1.0 release.

7 minutes ago, XLjedi said:

I have a backlog of unplayed games that I have to revert to from time-to-time...  I only buy them after they go into firesale el'cheapo mode so I tend to buy them in batches opportunistically and let em sit for awhile.  Come to think of it, I may have left KSP sit unplayed for nearly a year before tinkering with it.

I do the same thing, although I have about 40 games. There are a few that came in a bundle pack I will probably never play, but I too, look for the Steam sales that offer me the best deals. A while back ago, I bought the entire Tropico series because I wanted the original and Tropico 2 (after all, this one is pirates!). So, I now have 3, 4, and 5. I discovered KSP in Steam as a demo (0.18) when I was installing Civilization IV. Had it on the computer about six months before I began to play around with it.

@adsii1970@5thHorseman  I have like 100+ games on my wishlist that I just wait out on the price.  

Rimworld is actually my number 1 ranked game on the "to buy" wishlist right now, but all of my top 5 will need to go on sale before I pick em up!

  1. Rimworld
  2. Opus Magnum
  3. Shadow Tactics: Blades of the Shogun
  4. BATTLETECH
  5. XCOM 2: War of the Chosen

A sampling of games I have bought and are in my "next to be played queue" but in no particular order now include:

  • Motorsport Manager  ( I have played this a bit and like it, need to play the expansion now)
  • Atlantic Fleet
  • Homeworld:  Deserts of Kharak
  • Starmade
  • Starship Corporation
  • Steamworld Heist
  • Broforce! (LOL)
  • From the Depths
  • the entire Half-Life 2 series (LOL!)
  • Police Tactics: Imperio

Not to mention the handful of favorites that I've been meaning to return to...  another round of X-Com may be in order before War of the Chosen, and I should probably dust off my Elite Dangerous flying skills.

 

Edited August 7, 2018 by XLjedi

Heh...  Civ IV...  My son mentioned that game to me the other night in the following context:

His steam online gaming group of buddies were contemplating a game to play and Civ IV was suggested.

The response of one gamer friend:  "Nah, I've got somewhere to be in 8 hours."   LOL

Yup, too true. Earlier this summer, during the small break between the spring and summer semester, I played a 24 hour game - I started at 7:00 in the morning and at 7:00 the next morning, my wife asked me what time I had gotten up out of bed.

Here lately I actually do the whole random map, random civilization thing.
Garry's Mod now, most of it on the TritonRP server.
